@enothereska Might be easier to do the cherry-pick cleanly now that it's been squashed to a single commit on trunk. It looks like it's just 3 relatively small conflicts -- only reason I didn't resolve and commit myself is that I wasn't sure if we also wanted/needed to run system tests against the cherry-picked version given the size of the change.
@ijuma Added a helper function `outputSeparator` to cover all the 7 situations where `printTimestamp`, `printKey` and `printValue` are set with different values.

This broke the 0.10.2 build due to checkstyle errors:

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-0.10.2-jdk7/119/console

```text
:connect:runtime:checkstyleMain[ant:checkstyle] /home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/kafka-0.10.2-jdk7/connect/runtime/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/connect/runtime/rest/resources/ConnectorPluginsResource.java:55: ')' have incorrect indentation level 4, expected level should be 8.
 FAILED
```

Pushed a hotfix directly into 0.10.2 since it's a trivial formatting change:
https://github.com/apache/kafka/commit/d640259110be5113aca65129bb10de90d2a09527

The reason why it only happened in 0.10.2 is probably due to the fact that we are using a newer version of checkstyle in trunk.
Merged to 0.10.2. Please close this PR.
@mjsax @enothereska @miguno

Please review any of @enothereska @guozhangwang @mjsax, with Cc: to @ijuma

@ewencp I've tried looking at writing a test for over an hour but no success as I'm not familiar with the PowerMock / EasyMock libraries. I also have no idea how to trigger two commits in a row, including a long commit that would keep the `committing` flag to true (it goes to false right away no matter what I do, therefore never giving me the chance to get the timestamp comparison error). Anyway, I'd love to see making it part of 0.10.2.1, but I'm afraid I won't be able to provide a test in time, if at all. I'm happy for anyone to take ownership of my 1 line of work if they're able to write a test. Sorry I couldn't be more helpful
